intro: Kalopanax sumatranus, commonly known as the Sumatran cow-itch plant, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically 5 to 7 lobed. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by spiny, berry-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
